data: NICU Lumbar Puncture (Module)
Patient Care
POC Glucose Whole Blood
once, to compare with CSF result
Refer to NICU Vital Sign Monitoring Guideline
Vital Signs
Increase frequency of vital signs as per policy
Medications
morphine
50 mcg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
fentanyl
0.5 mcg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
1 mcg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
2 mcg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
3 mcg/kg, IV, pre-procedure, drug form: inj
Lidocaine-prilocaine is only to be used in infants with CGA greater than 34 weeks
lidocaine-prilocaine 2.5%-2.5% cream
1 application, topical, pre-procedure, drug form: cream
Laboratory
Communication Order
Hold CSF sample
Cell Count CSF (CWH)
Cerebrospinal fluid, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Glucose CSF
Cerebrospinal fluid, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Protein CSF
Cerebrospinal fluid, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Lactate CSF
Cerebrospinal fluid, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Consider consultation with Neurology and and/or Biochemical Diseases for the following CSF tests:
Amino Acids CSF
Cerebrospinal fluid, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Neurotransmitters CSF
Cerebrospinal fluid, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
CSF Culture
Cerebrospinal fluid, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
Pediatric CSF NAT
Cerebrospinal fluid, Urgent, Collection: T;N, once
